content.text:
# 1868 Upper Hunter colonial by-election

A by-election was held for the New South Wales Legislative Assembly electorate of Upper Hunter on 3 July 1868 due to the resignation of sitting member James White, who left the colony to travel to England, Europe and the United States.
Dates
{| class="wikitable"
! Date !! Event
|-
| 8 May 1868
| James White resigned.
|-
| 18 May 1868
| Writ of election issued by the Speaker of the Legislative Assembly.
|-
| 2 June 1868
| Nominations
|-
| 6 June 1868
| Polling day
|-
| 15 June 1868
| Return of writ
|-
| 24 June 1868
| Poll held at Jerry's Plains as no poll was held there on 6 June.
|-
| 21 August 1868
| Election proclaimed valid despite not being returned by 15 June.
|}
Results
with a majority of 248 votes, however the final results for Jerry's Plains do not appear to have been reported and are not included in the table.}}
}}
James White resigned.
